page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT,HIGH HAM AND AREA
page.content: 100 households were asked where they work. 35% work within the block. They are employed in a variety of ways: on the farms, in the 2 schools, computer programming, smallhold farming. About 8 people carry on 'gloving' by machines in their own homes. The material, sometimes ready cut, is brought to the homes from factories at Langport and Street, and is collected on completion. 35% of the people surveyed work within 10km of their homes. 25% work in towns or cities up to 50km away. Main places of work are Street,Langport,Bridgwater,Taunton, Yeovil. 5% have work which takes them all over the world. 1 villager is a timber expert who advises 3rd World countries on tree growth and timber marketing. Several of the farms are self-sufficient. One smallholding family barters milk for animal feed.
